errors.error_description: States that tablib requires Python 2.7 which is outdated and no longer supported
correction_candidates: Change to Python 3.7 or newer as the minimum requirement
Update to Python 3.8+ for modern compatibility
Specify Python 3.6+ as the minimum supported version
Remove version requirement and let users check PyPI for compatibility
errors.golden_answer: Change to Python 3.7 or newer as the minimum requirement

errors.error_description: Pins to a specific old version (0.12.1) instead of allowing users to get the latest version
correction_candidates: Remove version pinning and use pip install tablib
Change to pip install tablib>=1.0.0 for minimum version requirement
Use pip install --upgrade tablib to get the latest version
Specify pip install 'tablib>=0.14.0' for a more recent minimum
errors.golden_answer: Remove version pinning and use pip install tablib
